document.heading: District of Columbia Board of Elections and Ethics Primary Date Alteration Amendment Act of 2011

history.narrative: Law 19-7, the “District of Columbia Board of Elections and Ethics Primary Date Alteration Amendment Act of 2011”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-90, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 15, 2011, and April 5, 2011, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 27, 2011, it was assigned Act No. 19-53 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-7 became effective on June 16, 2011.
